raw_comment:
I noticed that in all the leagues except the MLB, the majority of the players were colored. I also noticed that in all the leagues, colored people were less than 50% of the total head coaches.

I wonder why MLB doesn't have a majority of colored people. I also wonder why colored people aren't the majority of head coaches in any of the leagues. 

This graph impacts my community and I positively, because it tells us that majority of players in most leagues are colored, so there is no discrimination in sports. However, it also impacts us negatively, because the graph implicates that colored people aren't the majority of head coaches in any of the leagues. 

My title for this graph is: "Majority of non-colored head coaches in leagues, but a majority of colored players in most leagues, is there a reason?"

In every league, colored people are less than 50 percent of the head coaches.

I wonder why colored people are not a majority of head coaches in any league.
This graph impacts my community positively.
The graph shows that in most leagues a majority of players are colored people.
I conclude that there is no discrimination in sports.

The graph implies that in every league colored people are not a majority of head coaches.
The title for this graph is: "Majority of non-colored head coaches in leagues, but a majority of colored players in most leagues, is there a reason?"
